intro: Thlaspi sylvestre proles arenarium, commonly known as the sandstone cabbages, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing plant characterized by its dense rosette of small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are typical of the mustard family. It is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils, often found in alpine or arctic environments. Its ability to thrive in harsh conditions makes it an important species in ecological studies of extreme habitats.
